adverbs.description: epistemologically (comparative more epistemologically, superlative most epistemologically)

entries.meaning: In a manner that pertains to epistemology.
examples: The more epistemologically interesting cases are those in which expertise is involved.

entries.meaning: (loosely) In a manner that pertains to knowledge or cognition.
examples: It has been argued that because an object is epistemologically dependent on an observer, it is also physically dependent on that observer.
